title: What is your LEAST favorite place you've ever been?

body: Guatemala City. Being a white man there is sketch as fuck, while I was there some drugged out guatemalans were driving around, hopping out and stabbing people. If you wanna spend the money they have some really nice hotels, but you best know EXACTLY where you're going if you leave the premises and get a legit taxi, or else they'll try to extort you. On the other hand one of my favorite places is Lake Attitlan, also in Guatemala. if you go just leave the cities ASAP.

post.body: For me, it was Vancouver, Canada.
post.title: What is your LEAST favorite place you've ever been?

body:
Corpus Christie TX. We popped down there for a day visit and I was not impressed. 

The beach was dirty, the sand was oddly colored, like it was dirty, and the waters black. You could see nothing but oil rigs one behind the other all along the coast. The water looked as if it were higher than my head when I was standing on the beach--I know its an optical illusion but it was crazy weird and disorienting to me. I've been to Cali, almost every state on the East Coast/beaches from VA down to FL, swam in Italy (both coasts), and off the coast of Iceland, and I'd rather go freeze my ass off in Icelandic waters again than even stand on the beach in Texas. 

Also, Qatar sucks in every way. Nothing but sand and hot air and sand. Nothing with common sense and a brain would actually chose to live there. There is literally NOTHING.
body_html:
Corpus Christie TX. We popped down there for a day visit and I was not impressed.

The beach was dirty, the sand was oddly colored, like it was dirty, and the waters black. You could see nothing but oil rigs one behind the other all along the coast. The water looked as if it were higher than my head when I was standing on the beach--I know its an optical illusion but it was crazy weird and disorienting to me. I've been to Cali, almost every state on the East Coast/beaches from VA down to FL, swam in Italy (both coasts), and off the coast of Iceland, and I'd rather go freeze my ass off in Icelandic waters again than even stand on the beach in Texas.

Also, Qatar sucks in every way. Nothing but sand and hot air and sand. Nothing with common sense and a brain would actually chose to live there. There is literally NOTHING.

post.body: For me, it was Vancouver, Canada.
post.title: What is your LEAST favorite place you've ever been?

body: The Red Zone in Detroit. The most dangerous part of the city. The fact that it used to be the third largest city in the U.S. makes sense when you see all of the acres of empty lots. As well as the busted up, run down buildings, with closed down businesses with old dated signs and painted ads from 30-50 years ago on them. Thats what globalization and ‘progress’ does to a city.

body: Even if they had the best intentions there is no way they could restore the city to its prime with the country’s economic policies being what they are. Detroit boomed from the industrial revolution entrepreneurism and labor union bargaining. The globalists were hellbent in destroying it asap, as soon as they could outsource and practically enslave third worlders by taking advantage of their lack of rights overseas.

parent.body:
Corpus Christie TX. We popped down there for a day visit and I was not impressed. 

The beach was dirty, the sand was oddly colored, like it was dirty, and the waters black. You could see nothing but oil rigs one behind the other all along the coast. The water looked as if it were higher than my head when I was standing on the beach--I know its an optical illusion but it was crazy weird and disorienting to me. I've been to Cali, almost every state on the East Coast/beaches from VA down to FL, swam in Italy (both coasts), and off the coast of Iceland, and I'd rather go freeze my ass off in Icelandic waters again than even stand on the beach in Texas. 

Also, Qatar sucks in every way. Nothing but sand and hot air and sand. Nothing with common sense and a brain would actually chose to live there. There is literally NOTHING.

body:
The problem with the riots is that the government, in their usual incompetent fashion, refused to really stop it and prevent it from happening again. Just like what we see today. So you have white flight. 

I think its a separate issue. There are very nice black neighborhoods in detroit. So the poverty isn't exactly racial like people like to think.

post.body: For me, it was Vancouver, Canada.
post.title: What is your LEAST favorite place you've ever been?

body:
The sand was brown because the earth is brown.  Sheesh, brown does not equal dirty.  How dumb are people?

Likewise the water in the Intracoastal Waterway has thousands of bayous emptying into it.  The water has tons of soil suspended in it.  It's not dirty.  Soil is not filth.  Jeez, it's just cringey to hear this kind of scientific ignorance spouted in public - by a supposedly well-traveled person who should know better!

parent.body:
Corpus Christie TX. We popped down there for a day visit and I was not impressed. 

The beach was dirty, the sand was oddly colored, like it was dirty, and the waters black. You could see nothing but oil rigs one behind the other all along the coast. The water looked as if it were higher than my head when I was standing on the beach--I know its an optical illusion but it was crazy weird and disorienting to me. I've been to Cali, almost every state on the East Coast/beaches from VA down to FL, swam in Italy (both coasts), and off the coast of Iceland, and I'd rather go freeze my ass off in Icelandic waters again than even stand on the beach in Texas. 

Also, Qatar sucks in every way. Nothing but sand and hot air and sand. Nothing with common sense and a brain would actually chose to live there. There is literally NOTHING.

post.body: For me, it was Vancouver, Canada.
post.title: What is your LEAST favorite place you've ever been?

body: The sand was dirty because debris, plastic, and detritus had either been dumped there by people, or washed up on shore. Garbage. In French that's *Gar-Baaage* to you. There were even streaks of oil in odd places, as if it were washing up on the sands--not a lot, but little streaks, so somewhere, something was leaking oil. I wouldn't have ever gotten in water on a beach with that much debris and even a hint of oil. Here's a tip for Texas.....try to be more environmentally friendly and people won't trash your beaches on a random web site as "dirty". It's just cringey to hear this kind of scientific ignorance spouted in public to defend the indefensible (snap)

body:
Corpus Christi is right next to Mexico, genius.  You think that might have something to do with it?  In Mexico they use rivers as toilets and dumpsters.  

>There were even streaks of oil in odd places

Jesus you're ignorant.  Those are from the oil platforms in the Gulf.  As long as you don't drink it like a martini, you're fine.  And you're welcome that all those oil platforms exist and pull out petroleum products that make your entire life possible.  Nah, let's just shit on the little people.  Well played, that's totally noble and not an act of bullying.

body: Almost anywhere in New Jersey. Atlantic city was fun because it's seedy and decrepit, but anywhere else just seems smelly or like a lie. Even the rich parts make me think it's a facade for people to pretend they don't live in New Jersey. Also, I tried to go on a bar crawl near Yale once (CT) and it was so lame that I just couldn't help but hate the whole place for being such a hipster shithole.
